edu.cnm.deepdive.celestialbodies.util

Class TimeUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.celestialbodies.util.TimeUtil

  • public class TimeUtil
extends Object
    Utilities for working with Dates and times. This class is used by the Celestial Bodies app for necessary calculations for determining right ascension and declination.
    Author:
    Kevin Serafini, Brent Bryan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Date calculateGregorianDate(double jd)
      Convert the given Julian Day to Gregorian Date (in UT time zone).
      static double calculateJulianDay(Date date)
      Calculate the Julian Day for a given date using the following formula: JD = 367 * Y - INT(7 * (Y + INT((M + 9)/12))/4) + INT(275 * M / 9) + D + 1721013.5 + UT/24 Note that this is only valid for the year range 1900 - 2099.
      static int[] clockTimeFromHrs(double ut)
      Take a universal time between 0 and 24 and return a triple [hours, minutes, seconds].
      static double julianCenturies(Date date)
      Calculate the number of Julian Centuries from the epoch 2000.0 (equivalent to Julian Day 2451545.0).
      static float meanSiderealTime(Date date, float longitude)
      Calculate local mean sidereal time in degrees.
      static double normalizeAngle(double angle)
      Normalize the angle to the range 0 less than or equal to value less than 360.
      static double normalizeHours(double time)
      Normalize the time to the range 0 less than or equal to value less than 24.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • julianCenturies

        public static double julianCenturies(Date date)
        Calculate the number of Julian Centuries from the epoch 2000.0 (equivalent to Julian Day 2451545.0).

      • calculateJulianDay

        public static double calculateJulianDay(Date date)
        Calculate the Julian Day for a given date using the following formula: JD = 367 * Y - INT(7 * (Y + INT((M + 9)/12))/4) + INT(275 * M / 9) + D + 1721013.5 + UT/24 Note that this is only valid for the year range 1900 - 2099.

      • calculateGregorianDate

        public static Date calculateGregorianDate(double jd)
        Convert the given Julian Day to Gregorian Date (in UT time zone). Based on the formula given in the Explanitory Supplement to the Astronomical Almanac, pg 604.

      • meanSiderealTime

        public static float meanSiderealTime(Date date,
                                     float longitude)
        Calculate local mean sidereal time in degrees. Note that longitude is negative for western longitude values.

      • normalizeAngle

        public static double normalizeAngle(double angle)
        Normalize the angle to the range 0 less than or equal to value less than 360.

      • normalizeHours

        public static double normalizeHours(double time)
        Normalize the time to the range 0 less than or equal to value less than 24.

      • clockTimeFromHrs

        public static int[] clockTimeFromHrs(double ut)
        Take a universal time between 0 and 24 and return a triple [hours, minutes, seconds].
        Parameters:
        ut - Universal time - presumed to be between 0 and 24.
        Returns:
        [hours, minutes, seconds]
